gameDetails.venue: Xcel Energy Center, St. Paul, MN

keyFactors.title: Home Ice Advantage
keyFactors.description: Wild have been excellent at Xcel Energy Center. The crowd provides energy and the team feeds off it.

keyFactors.title: Flames Road Struggles
keyFactors.description: Calgary has been inconsistent away from home. Young team still finding consistency on the road.

keyFactors.title: Goaltending Edge
keyFactors.description: Minnesota's goaltending has been a strength. Providing solid foundation for the defense-first approach.

keyFactors.title: Value at -130
keyFactors.description: Model showed fair price around -120. Getting slight value on a home favorite with strong metrics.

riskFactors: Calgary can score in bunches when hot
Any game can flip on a bad bounce

quarterBreakdown.description: Wild controlled tempo from the start. Took early lead on power play goal. Established defensive structure.
Minnesota extended advantage. Calgary struggled to generate quality chances. Wild's system suffocating.
Calgary pulled within 1 but Wild locked down. Empty net goal sealed the 4-2 final. Professional closeout.

gameResults.whenCleared: Wild controlled throughout. Never in serious jeopardy after building early lead.
gameResults.gamePace: Moderate pace. Wild dictated tempo with their defensive structure. Limited Calgary's transition opportunities.

whatWentRight.title: Home Ice Dominance
whatWentRight.description: Wild controlled the game from puck drop. Home crowd energized the team and they executed their game plan.

whatWentRight.title: Power Play Execution
whatWentRight.description: Converted on the power play while Calgary went 0-for on their opportunities. Special teams difference was crucial.

whatWentRight.title: Goaltending Delivered
whatWentRight.description: 92% save percentage was exactly what was needed. Made key saves when Calgary pushed.

whatWentRight.title: Third Period Defense
whatWentRight.description: When Calgary closed to within 1, Wild didn't panic. Played patient, structured hockey and sealed it with empty netter.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Clean, professional win. Wild were the better team and the scoreboard reflected it. No lucky bounces needed - just solid execution of game plan.

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight positive CLV as line moved toward Wild. Market agreed Minnesota was the right side.

keyTakeaways: Home favorites with strong goaltending are reliable NHL plays
Wild's defensive structure travels well at home
Special teams often decide tight NHL games
Professional teams close out games when they have the lead
Value existed at -130 and we captured it
verdict: Solid, professional victory. Wild controlled the game start to finish. Goaltending, home ice, and structure all delivered. This is what a clean NHL ML win looks like.
